criteria: Application of Knowledge to Personal Health Goals
descriptions: Student demonstrates no understanding of personal nutrition needs.
Student shows minimal understanding of personal nutrition, lacking specific details.
Student identifies some personal nutrition needs but with limited accuracy and depth.
Student accurately identifies most personal nutrition needs with reasonable explanations.
Student comprehensively understands and accurately assesses personal nutrition needs with detailed explanations.
Student demonstrates exceptional understanding of personal nutrition, accurately assesses needs, and proposes insightful strategies for improvement.
Student demonstrates no ability to assess their physical activity level.
Student shows a basic awareness of physical activity but cannot accurately assess their own level.
Student attempts to assess physical activity level but with significant inaccuracies and omissions.
Student provides a generally accurate assessment of their physical activity level with some supporting details.
Student accurately assesses their physical activity level with clear and specific examples.
Student provides a comprehensive and insightful assessment of their physical activity level, including analysis of its impact on health and well-being.
Student does not connect nutrition or activity assessment to personal health goals.
Student makes a weak connection between assessment results and general health goals.
Student identifies a basic link between their assessment and health goals but lacks specifics.
Student explains how their nutritional and activity assessment relates to achieving specific health goals.
Student clearly articulates how their assessment informs strategies for achieving personal health goals, providing concrete examples.

Student synthesizes assessment results into a comprehensive plan for achieving personal health goals, demonstrating a deep understanding of the relationship between nutrition, activity, and overall well-being.
